column5: Had a chance to go out today and fish the falls of the Ohio river in here in Louisville. The river was finally low enough to fish. You can catch pretty much anything in this river including: walleye, sauger, white bass, stripers, hybrid bass, smallmouth, largemouth, paddle fish, carp, gar, etc.  Today i fished for a two hours using Jigs and small crank baits. I was able to catch a few small saugers, a few white bass, two drums, a few shad and a new species i have never caught before a small flat head catfish. Now im just looking forward to coming up to ontario to fish for some muskies soon.  Falls of the Ohio River  Falls of the Ohio River  Small Flat Head  Small sauger  White bass
Good mixed bag of fish, WTG, thanks for the report and pic's...
Great report and pics Matt!!!  I hope you cleaned that mud off your boots before you went into the house...
Hey Matt, are you coming back for good or just for the summer?  Great report, btw.
Looks like  a nice stretch of whater there and plenty of species to keep things interesting and the fisherman guessing.  Cool pics.

i will be only coming up for the summer I have 6 weeks off from work, so i will be spending that time fishing! I will be probably be here for another 2 years until i finish my dissertation. i am trying to convince my wife to move to Ontario.
Nice report Matt ! Great selection of fish there for sure.
Yup, cool mixed bag of fish. I imagine those flatheads can get real big.  Thanks for report.  ehg
Nice report Matt. Thanks for sharing.
It was good seeing all the different species of fish you brought in... great report!   Jen

Hey...great report Matt!  It's great to see success from fellow shore anglers...nice mix of fish too.  Six weeks off work...wow...I'm sure you'll have a great time fishing!!  Sign up your wife on here with her own OFC username...we'll all convince her to move up here....LOL.
Nice.Got to love it when you dont know what you will catch next! Joe
Geez, that's a great place to fish, never know what you're gonna get....thanks for sharing...  maureen
it'd be nice if i can get down there one day ... so nice how u get a mix of everything!  thanks for the report!
Don't mean to step on Matt's thread but down here while fishing most rivers or lakes that contain multi species those jigs with twister tails will catch anything at any time of the year.  Whopper
